html: King Hezekiah’s delegation to Rabshakeh consists of the trusted inner circle of his court. Rabshakeh commences his communique from Sennacherib with the same introductory words the Hebrew prophets use when representing Jehovah according to ancient Near Eastern custom: “Thus says...” The title “great king” defines Sennacherib’s role as a king of kings and lord of lords—that is, as emperor over the local kings of his empire who serve as his vassals or subordinates. Rabshakeh’s overbearing attitude in his speech that follows (vv 4-10) reflects the arrogance of ancient Assyrian conquerors.
